title: How to Fix a Dented Baseboard

steps.headline: Locate the dent.
steps.description: It's a good idea to place down something to kneel on while you're working, such as a cushion or a gardener's kneeling pad.

steps.headline: Stick a thumbtack into the dent to make a prick hole.
Apply just a dab of water to the dent.
Cover the whole hole and surround space of baseboard with a cloth such as a sheet or pillowcase.
Press a bottle cap to the area of the dent.
Iron over the wood to expand it.
steps.description: Remove the bottle cap and fabric cover. The dent should now have been removed.

tyn: Fabric such as old sheet or pillowcase
text: Locate the dent. It's a good idea to place down something to kneel on while you're working, such as a cushion or a gardener's kneeling pad. Stick a thumbtack into the dent to make a prick hole.  Apply just a dab of water to the dent.  Cover the whole hole and surround space of baseboard with a cloth such as a sheet or pillowcase.  Press a bottle cap to the area of the dent.  Iron over the wood to expand it. Remove the bottle cap and fabric cover. The dent should now have been removed. Repaint as needed.
sentences: It's a good idea to place down something to kneel on while you're working, such as a cushion or a gardener's kneeling pad.
Stick a thumbtack into the dent to make a prick hole.
Apply just a dab of water to the dent.
Cover the whole hole and surround space of baseboard with a cloth such as a sheet or pillowcase.
Press a bottle cap to the area of the dent.
Iron over the wood to expand it.
Remove the bottle cap and fabric cover.
The dent should now have been removed.
